Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anastasios F
Reviews.Content: Nice location. Very warm staff. Rooms are not very big but always clean. Recommended for short stay (2-3 days) because of location

Reviews.Title: “Value”
Reviews.Author: Rasberry9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Martini in Jan 2012. Close to the station about 10 minute walk,bit far to the centre of Verona but taxis readily available,the room was spacious clean bathroom large enough breakfast adequate,hotel staff helpful recommending restaurants trains etc.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: GVA1963
Reviews.Content: Location: Excellent location. Reasonabily close to many touristic locations. Convenient for Open Tours, Metro or even walking around Rooms: Not too big, but maintained well. Linen and towels were clean and fresh. Even though the hotel was on the main road side, we could sleep without much noice from the traffic. Toilets: Clean and well maintained. Hot water available. Food: The restaurent is very small, but my family enjoyed the breakfast. Lift: Again it was small, but functioning. there was no breakdown Luggage Storage: No seperate place to keep the luggage after check out, but they kept them in the lobby until we arrive after visits. Staff: This is a family run facility and they were very cooperative. They speak English well enough Overall: WE LIKED IT.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Martini - Rome Oct 2011”
Reviews.Author: sueandgavan
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Martini. After becoming ill, the Hotel went out of their way to help, offer advice and support.

Reviews.Title: “recommanded”
Reviews.Author: darinec
Reviews.Content: very well located, shopping street yet not expensive one, station is 10 minutes walk, you can see all center of rome by walking, room is clean, we could hear the bells and was not that annoying; breakfast very vey basic.

Reviews.Title: “Location was good.”
Reviews.Author: Lina_oz
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights in July 2011. Room was a good size with good bathroom. Conveniently located close to Roma Termini (about 15 min walk). It was shock when the floor began to shake and I literally mean shake! Especially at night with each passing by car but I was assured that it was normal and soon you will get used to vibration :) Very poor breakfast, from all hotels we stayed in it was the worst in terms of breakfast. Service ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nice one...”
Reviews.Author: MaureenRiga_Latvia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right in the centre and not far from Termini station and major sightseeing...but the owner of the building should better invest in desinfection - few chucroaches came to say "hello" when i was taking shower....

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: INDKIG
Reviews.Content: Nice personnel, spacious and comforting rooms (we had very quiet one - exceptional for Rome's central location), very clean, good breakfast. We will always consider this hotel for our next trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “rude staff, service industry training would be good for all staff in this place”
Reviews.Author: tassiemouse
Reviews.Content: This is in walking distance from the train station and is in good walking distance to most of the sites. Upon arrival we found that the hotel was on the fourth floor and the only way to get there was by steps or a very old lift, which requires passengers to close the three doors before it can move. This can be an issue as people who leave the doors open on the fifth floor stopping others access unless you are willing to climb the five flights of stairs and then close the doors. My partner had mobility issues after longs walks and we were caught on a couple of occasions. I had to fetch the lift and bring it to my partner to access the hotel. The hotel lift is not wheelchair accessible (to small). We arrived to a very small but well-kept room, the day was hot and we asked the staff where the control was to the air conditioning, we had to ask another three times before staff told us they normally don’t give out the controls until June the 1st! We eventually got the control and a rude response. The internet password was the next battle then we needed a fridge for medication. All seemed a little hard! The internet connection was the best we had on this trip. Downloading English speaking shows on YouTube without any problems or buffering. The bed was comfortable the street noise below well insulated by double glazing. One night we hear plumbing noises and told the staff, after investigation the staff old us it was the Americans next door who leave the taps and heaters on. He was quite derogatory towards Americans. This was our last stay in Europe and we unloaded our Euros before going to the airport, only leaving ourselves with enough for a couple of drinks at the airport, but on departure from the hotel we were informed that we had to pay Rome tax In cash. We didn’t have enough, only on travel cards, again we got a rude response from staff as he threw his hands up in the air. His colleague eventually accepted what cash we had left and we left the hotel. Service industry training would be good for all staff in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Roman holiday in a lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: VikaKnyazeva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from 7 to 15 June. The hotel is very nice and cozy. The room was good and spacious with a beautiful interior and new bathroom. Hotel is located in one of the most popular city streets with a lot of shops and cafes. We were lucky with an amazing view from the window at the old church. Staff in the hotel is very very friendly and hospitable. Nice breakfast with a good coffee! Grazie per tutto! Speriamo di tornare al vostro albergo!:)))

Reviews.Title: “good location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ionovna
Reviews.Content: Location is very good, near the Roma Termini (10 min by walking), public transport and many points of interest, shops. The rooms are clean. The internet is free of charge. Very pleasant staff. Good price. When we come to Rome we stay here because of we like this hotel. Very recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Antuanetta
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome in February. After our cold winter weather was awsome (+ 15/17 degrees). Few words about hotel: perfect location, right in a center; friendly stuff, good rooms (a little bit noisy though). Breakfast was poor but for 3* hotel it' ok. If you're going for a few nights and don't want to spend lots of money it'll be a good choice. Have a nice trip!:))

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but choose another hotel on this street!”
Reviews.Author: Adam_G79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights and were pretty disappointed. The owner was the most unfriendly woman we've ever encountered at a hotel and was quite rude most of the time. We arrived at 12.15pm and there were no rooms ready, even though the check in time was from midday. We had to wait in the luggage room until about 1pm, and when we got into the room in stank of cigarette smoke. Rooms were large and bathroom was good, but overall it was pretty dirty (fan in the room had so much dust in it, we cleaned it ourself upon arrival). Fair bit of noise from traffic outside of room, but it is a main street of Rome. Breakfast was from 7.30am-10am, but you have to get there early because the food wasn't replenished and anyone eating at 9am had a very limited selection as a result. But not too early, we arrived at 7.30am one day and they were still setting up until about 7.45am. The breakfast area is also very small, only has 4 tables for 2 people and therefore cannot provide breakfast to many guests at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Margarida7977
Reviews.Content: I went with a group of friends, we were all 5 girls that stay in a triple bedroom and a double bedroom, at the Hotel Martini in Rome. It was easy to access the hotel, situated at the Via Nazionale, walking distance from the Termini Station and several monuments. The triple bedroom was nice, spacius, with a clean bathroom with a shower, but one of the beds were more like and extra bed. The windows were big, with a view to the road. The double bedroom was smaller and had troubles with the hot water. It was too hot and no cold, and there were 40º celsius outside! It took them at least 2 days to solve the problem and my friends had to shower at my room. During our 4 days stay we saw 5 different recepcionists! But the night guy was a little too friendly to one of my friends, always telling she was "bella" and had nice legs. Please... The breakfast was monotonous, but, for me, as long as they have coffee and milk, bread and butter, i'm ok with it, and their expresso was very good. The last night we only had 2 towel for three people and the reception guy couldn't find any more! Above all, the best of it was the air conditioned, because the weather was very hot during that week.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: IrinaVoicu
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, near the public transport and many points of interest. Clean room. Very pleasant staff. All in all, we liked it there.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: nursejenh
Reviews.Content: What a way to end a trip! I will start with the positives- central location and close to Metro and Termini, quiet room even though it's on a busy street, nice bathroom. Now the deal busters- the beds are uncomfortable, the mosquitoses (at least we were hoping the bites were from mosquitoes) we each had no fewer than 20 each, the staff was barely pleasant and sometimes rude. One staff member accused me of not closing the elevator door. It's a quaint old elevator with a metal gate on the outside and two doors on the inside that you have to shut in order for it to move. Not hard to get especially since I once lived in a building with a similar elevator. He didn't believe me when I said I had shut it, he made me go check! The coffee was terrible. The breakfast highlights were canned fruit cocktail, individual cheese food wrapped in plastic (aka Kraft singles), pastries and yogurt. All of this I could take for a few days especially with the fabulous espresso downstairs at the Irish Pub. All hell broke loose when we went to check out. The price was suddenly higher. We had brought the email with our reservation confirmation and price but Elenora wouldn't look at it. She kept insisting we had used a web site in which the price was higher. She had one of my travel partners credit card number and passport number on it. We had never even heard of that web site. She was actually yelling at us. This went on for about 20 minutes meanwhile our taxi is waiting impatiently downstairs. Did I say she was yelling at us? I'm sure the entire hotel could hear. We finally told her she could take 800euro or nothing and we were leaving. This was all we had and it was a compromise between the two prices. We had to ask for a receipt with "paid in full" on it. She continued to yell at us as we walked out the door. We were then greeted by an upset taxi driver whom wanted to charge us more. It was truely awful, unlike any experience I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Just had to laugh after a while...”
Reviews.Author: TurtleHawaii
Reviews.Content: We didn't expect much and that is exactly what we got. The hotel is inside an apartment like building, they just bought out the fourth floor. Above our room must have been a young family with a screaming baby and a bunch of toddlers racing around the room because all we heard were cries and stomping foot steps. The room we had was really..really...pink. The only saving grace was the air conditioning system that drowned out the reception desks television which we could hear through the walls. We did get a lot of excercise through going up and down 4 flights of stairs because we were too scared to use the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not even 3 star....”
Reviews.Author: elloydn
Reviews.Content: On arrival you are greeted with an iron cage lift that clanks its way down to you. Unfortunately that about as good as it gets.... The first room we were shown to was musty, grimy and unpleasant. The airconditioner was leaking water into the room and judging by the stains on the curtains had been doing so for quite some time. We were moved to another room which was cleaner but still in need of significant refurbishment. The shower door had to be held on by hand while you had a shower or risk being clouted on the head with it. We didn't realise upon check in that the 2nd room we were taken to was facing the very noisy street - even 4 floors up the traffic noise was terrible. Traffic noise was the least of our problems as it turned out - the Irish bar directly below the hotel stays open until 3am and has tables on the street. Noise from this establishment made it almost impossible to sleep. The breakfast provided is extremely light on, somewhat stale and basically unpleasant. At $150 Euros a night this hotel is having a laugh. The only positive thing I have to say about this hotel is that it is in walking distance to Roma Termini. Just say no!

Reviews.Title: “Very recommended”
Reviews.Author: AnnaJer
Reviews.Content: Very good location, quiet and suffer area, near the public transport and many point of interesting. Clean,warm room. Very pleasant stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripjopi
Reviews.Content: W e stay just 3 days but we feel as at home. Hotel at 4th floor at Nazionale Avenue, near trevi fountan and more important monuments. Room very clean and quiet. Breakfast could be better just 4 tables and very small place to eat. Staff very friendly and one of them speaks a lot of languages. He give us very exactly information about places and tours!!!!!! If I come back to this wonderful city I'm very sure that I return to this Small but Great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: franky67
Reviews.Content: Terrible experience. Very noisy, dated, worn and dirty room. The staff very rude and unhelpful. The breakfast is just nothing, horrible coffee and hard roll. If you don't want to ruin your holiday do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Martini very much on the rocks”
Reviews.Author: gaacopy
Reviews.Content: Just home from our New Year's break in Rome and I have to admit it's hard to write this review in an objective manner after the treatment myself and my partner received at the Hotel Martini but here goes. Firstly, the positives, and there were, admittedly, a number of them with the Hotel Martini, - Decent location - Charming building - Basic but well maintained room Now for the negative and what a great stinking negative it was; Upon arrival the old lady at reception hiked up the cost of our stay for four nights from EUR480 to EUR880 - even though I had received confirmation of the original price by e-mail and had the reservation voucher number to hand! Apparently there had been a 'big mistake with the computer'. The lady's argument was that the Hotel Martini would 'never agree to EUR480 for four nights at this time of year' - it was a New Year's break. Apparently an email was sent to me explaining all of this and because I didn't reply to it - hard to reply to an email that you never received - my booking was cancelled. Despite this, there was - 'luckily' said the lady at reception - one very last room available in the hotel for four nights, to the very same spec that we'd been looking for! After a three hour flight from Dublin and all the accompanying hassles of such a trip myself and my partner were in no position to argue. There and then our trip became a budget break with much of our spending money now gone. Hopefully we'll get back to Rome some day but we certainly won't go anywhere near this place. For the record the Hotel Martini is way too noisy as its location - just off the Via Nazionale and adjacent to some sort of church that gongs mercilessly in the mornings - ensures that you're awake with the birds.

Reviews.Title: “we would definately go back”
Reviews.Author: liveaid
Reviews.Content: We originally had arrived to Repubblica hotel in Via Nazionale, but this place was so horrible we fortunatly found Martini hotel one block up across the street. The same price but really what a difference! This place was really clean and the staff incredibly welcoming- a jewel hard to find in Rome´s budget hotels. We had a great stay would defintaly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: JfromtheBlock
Reviews.Content: Martini wasn't too bad! Location: This hotel is located nearby the Plaza Republicca and also to the Termini Station. Carrani tours (near Plaza Republicca) offers MP3 audio guides for approx 8 euros. Breakfast - Not so good... It's preferable to eat out vs eat at this hotel. The front desk guy is also the guy that makes your espresso. Rooms - Clean but watch out for the bed which is really a bowl! As well the shutters don't close very well so you'll get a lot of light. Note: the key for the safe and for the front door are the old skeleton keys. This means that when you unlock your door to enter, you must lock it from the inside in order to lock it. Elevator - The elevator is one of those cool old Otis elevators that require you to open a door and gate to ride the elevator. For the location, you get what you pay for. If you want quiet nights and extremely comfy beds, you need to pick a more expensive hotel OR stay in the suburbs.

Reviews.Title: “for this price you can do better”
Reviews.Author: bostontravel2
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Italy and stayed at this hotel for one night. I was very dissappointed. It was the most expensive hotel we stayed at during our trip, including Venice, which is known to be more expensive. The room had a horrible smell and the toilet only flushed occasionally. One of the shower doors was off the track which meant the bathroom got soaked when you took a shower. The desk clerk also gave us incorrect information about the train schedule causing us to miss the train we should have taken. I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend to everyone!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Martini Hotel, Rome with my family from June 19 to June 24 in this year. It is a family operated small hotel. The price for the quadro room was 170 euro. The hotel locates on the 4th floor of the very nice building with the elevator. The room was spacey, and it was nicely decorated. The bathroom was huge and nice! There were some scratches on the ceiling, but we could see it only when we looked up, and it was not really major defect. The conditioner worked a little weak, but the owner fixed it for us, and it started working perfectly. We really enjoyed staying in this hotel. The breakfast was simple, but nice. The cappuccino and espresso were made individually for each person and were great. The staff spoke English, and everyone was very nice. The location of the hotel is very good. 15 minutes walking to the Trevi Fountains. We did not use the bus at all and walked everywhere: Coliseum, Forum, even to Vatican (35 minutes nice walk), but the bus stop is right across a street, and the muni station is around the corner. The hotel located on the famous street Via Nationally with a lot of nice shops and small restaurants. Next to the hotel's door is a very nice bar with outside seating area. My parents are planning to go to Italy next summer, and I recommended them this hotel from all of my heart. It will be impossible to find better place for this price especially if you have a family of 4 people and do not mind to share the room with your kids.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Martini
HotelInfo.Address: Via Nazionale, 18, 00184 Rome, Italy
